The vertical trend in the τ
cr of the sediment cores in the upper most several metres was generally non-significant, although a slight trend of increase with depth was found in a few cores (Fig. 5). Based on the hydrodynamic measurements, the τ
cr for the upper most several metres was much higher than τ
cw-min and much lower than τ
cw-mean and τ
cw-max (Fig. 5). Based on CHIRP subbottom seismic profiling measurements, the sediments deposited during the past 2000 years is approximately 10–20 m in thickness (Fig. 6). These modern sediments are fine grained and have a similar median size to the surficial sediments.
